intro: Morisonia stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals that are narrow and elongated. Morisonia stenopetala is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
